Trump wants America to think the #TrumpShutdown is a fight about border security. 

In reality, he‚Äôs used less than 6% of funding already given to him for border security.

Some good news in the midst of the #TrumpShutdown: my bipartisan bill that ensures the US will continue to lead in nuclear innovation cleared the House and is on its way to be signed into law. A good step in our fight against climate change.

Now @realDonaldTrump has gotten what he said he wanted ‚Äî a shutdown that puts our economy at risk and forces federal employees to work without pay just days before Christmas. 

The absolute least our government should be able to do is keep the lights on. Americans deserve better.

This shutdown could have easily been avoided. Two days ago, the entire Senate ‚Äî 100 Democrats and Republicans ‚Äî voted to fund the government at the exact same levels President Trump agreed to last year. But, once again, @realDonaldTrump refused to take yes for an answer.

A #Trumpshutdown means 54,000 Customs and Border Patrol officers ‚Äì the agents who actually work to secure the border ‚Äì will work without pay over Christmas. If @realDonaldTrump was serious about border security, he wouldn‚Äôt shutdown the agency responsible for securing our borders
Your own words are very stubborn things, @realDonaldTrump https://twitter.com/SenatorLeahy/status/1076146932668616704¬†‚Ä¶

.@realDonaldTrump says this fight is about border security. It is not.

There will be more I will want to say as we remember #POTUS41 in the days and weeks ahead. For now, Martha and I send our sincerest condolences to the Bush family and pray that President George H.W. Bush may rest in peace. Fair winds and following seas, my friend.
But, above all, he was a good man who treated others with kindness and respect. He knew we could disagree without being disagreeable. We could all learn a great deal from the example he set.

George H.W. Bush was a public servant who dedicated his life to our country ‚Äî as a decorated Navy pilot, as a congressman, as a diplomat, as CIA Director, as Vice President and as our President. He believed in our institutions and exemplified what it means to be a true leader.
